message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's symptoms suggest that he has schizophrenia and he has been started on antipsychotic therapy. Difficulty walking and tremors are common side effects of dopamine antagonist medications, which are used to treat schizophrenia. The other options do not typically cause these symptoms.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest a psychotic disorder, and the development of difficulty walking and tremor suggests extrapyramidal symptoms (EPS). EPS are commonly associated with dopamine antagonists, which are used to treat psychotic disorders.

The new symptoms of difficulty walking and tremor suggest the use of dopamine antagonist medications, which can cause movement disorders as a side effect. This is known as drug-induced parkinsonism.
